page.title: 12BROUGH LAW CAMPSITE
page.content: Brough-law is a hill of 950' in the east of the area looking down into the Ingram Valley. It is sometimes also known as Ewe Hill. A popular footpath takes visitors to the summit of this hill. On the summit is a ring of boulders up to 50m wide.This marks the position of an ancient campsite which is thought to be at least 2000 yrs old. There are actually two rings of boulders around the gentler S and E slopes. This was for added protection against enemies. In the N and W where the slopes are much steeper, there is only one ring of stones. For even greater protection,animals were herded between the two rings so that they would give an alarm if intruders attempted to attack the site. It is thought that this was not only an ancient site but the site of an ancient temple,
